page.title: 05THE POPULATION OF HASTINGS
page.content: The population of Hastings was about 1500 in the mid sixteenth century. By 1861 it was 20,000. The rapid growth of tourism after the growth of rail communications resulted in a population of 50,000 by 1891.By 1981 it was 75,000. The structure of the population is unusual because the biggest age group is between 60 and 69 because of the town attraction to retired people. There is a trend for people between 20 and 39 to move away looking for better employment. This means the town has a low birth rate.
